summary: This bill, the State-Based Universal Health Care Act of 2025, allows states to apply for waivers to amend provisions of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, enabling them to establish universal healthcare systems for their residents. It outlines requirements for state plans, including comprehensive coverage, affordability, and public administration. The bill establishes an Independent Assessment Panel and details processes for federal oversight, public input, and coordination between federal agencies. It also includes provision for American Indians and Alaska Natives and addresses reporting and review mechanisms.
